Description: Necklace: a string of long convex bicone crumb beads composed of light-blue crumbs on a dark-blue glazed composition background.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3248 Found in front of the knees of a woman.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.345 & 1930,0711.343 & 1930,0711.344), necklaces (1930,0711.348 & 1930,0711.349 & 1930,0711.350 & 1930,0711.351), shell (1930,0711.347). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 120, 126; pl.LXXVI, 52; Tomb register, pl. LXXI; Bead register, pl.LXXIB.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (626)
